title: Sailing Vessels Quiz
description: Hoist the sails and test your recall of historic and modern sailing vessels

questions.question: A 'schooner' is a sailing vessel typically characterized by having what type of rigging?
options: Two or more masts with fore-and-aft sails

questions.question: The America's Cup is the oldest international competition in which sport?
A 'sloop' is a single-masted sailboat with how many sails in its basic configuration?
What is the 'keel' of a sailing vessel?
options: The structural backbone along the bottom of the hull

questions.question: A 'brigantine' is a two-masted vessel with what sail arrangement?
options: Square sails on the foremast and fore-and-aft on the mainmast

questions.question: The 'Cutty Sark,' a famous 19th-century ship preserved in Greenwich, was what type of vessel?
A 'dhow' is a traditional sailing vessel associated with which region?
What is the 'boom' on a sailboat?
options: The sound the hull makes on waves
The horizontal pole extending from the mast to hold the foot of the sail

questions.question: A 'junk' is a traditional sailing vessel from which part of the world?
The term 'starboard' refers to which side of a ship?
A 'yawl' differs from a 'ketch' primarily in what way?
options: Its mizzen mast is positioned aft of the rudder post

questions.question: The 'spinnaker' is a type of sail used for what purpose?
A 'felucca' is a traditional wooden sailing boat found along which river?
What does it mean to 'tack' when sailing?
options: To change direction by turning the bow through the wind

questions.question: The 'Kon-Tiki' was a raft sailed by Thor Heyerdahl across which ocean in 1947?
